title: Deutsches Derby
text:
The Deutsches Derby is a <a href="Conditions%20races">Group 1</a> <a href="Flat%20racing">flat</a> <a href="Horse%20racing">horse race</a> in <a href="Germany">Germany</a> open to three-year-old <a href="thoroughbred">thoroughbred</a> <a href="Colt%20%28horse%29">colts</a> and <a href="Filly">fillies</a>. It is run at <a href="Horner%20Rennbahn">Hamburg-Horn</a> over a distance of 2,400 metres (about 1½ miles), and it is scheduled to take place each year in July.
It is Germany's equivalent of <a href="Epsom%20Derby">The Derby</a>, a famous race in England.
History.
The event was established in 1869, and it was originally called the Norddeutsches Derby. It became known as the Deutsches Derby in 1889.
For most of its history the race has been held at Hamburg. It has also been staged at <a href="Grunewald">Grunewald</a> (1919), <a href="Hoppegarten">Hoppegarten</a> (1943–44), <a href="Munich">Munich</a> (1946) and <a href="Cologne-Weidenpesch%20Racecourse">Cologne</a> (1947). It was titled the Grosser Deutschlandpreis der Dreijährigen during World War II.
The present system of race grading was introduced in Germany in 1972, and the Deutsches Derby was given Group 1 status.
The race was sponsored by <a href="BMW">BMW</a> from 1991 to 2008. It was backed by IDEE Kaffee from 2009 to 2011 and <a href="Sparda-Bank">Sparda-Bank</a> from 2012 to 2014 before IDEE returned as sponsors from 2015.
